Verifying identity in context of vaccination status would be a great application of zero knowledge tech. Anyone have ideas?  4/

I don't think anyone cares to steal my identity. And I could choose not to go to restaurants. But who can say how this type of requirement will expand? And even if just .001% of cases lead to misuse, across the population, that's not insubstantial  3/

My ID has my full legal name, birthday, and address -- with just a subset of that info, one could track me down or pretend to be me in certain contexts (e.g., retrieving some health info over phone normally just requires full name and date of birth) 2/
Not an anti-vaxxer but still find it alarming that I have to show my ID with my proof of vaccination every time I go to a restaurant. Feels like mandatory in-real-life KYC 1/

RT @BlockchainAssn: We're honored and excited to have Dragonfly Capital as a @BlockchainAssn member! The industry has so much work to do inâ€¦
Through our association with BA, we hope to help advance crypto policy in a way that responsibly considers the most promising innovations in the industry. 4/

We decided to join BA primarily to represent the voices and interests of portfolio companies and crypto founders who build cutting edge technologies but may not have the time or resources to engage policymakers themselves. 3/

It was clear to us that thoughtfully crafted law and regulation are fundamental to the growth and adoption of the crypto industry. And educating our policymakers is instrumental to helping them design wise approaches. 2/
Delighted to announce that Dragonfly Capital has joined @BlockchainAssn! 1/
